        Parameters:
        choice - specify which attribute to return. 0 for day, 1 for month, 2 for year, 3 for randomly generated date including day, month and year
        Returns:
        string representation of the date specified by the choice option

      • parseSingleFileNameCollision

        public static java.io.File parseSingleFileNameCollision(java.io.File afile,
                                                        java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> filelist)
        Name collision check for a single file, called when renameing a single file
        Parameters:
        afile - the target file
        filelist - can be null, in which case name collision scope is restricted in the afile's directory
        Returns:
        the file name without conflicting with the file list

      • isFileNameCollided

        public static boolean isFileNameCollided(java.io.File afile,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> fileList,
                                         int eindex)
        Checks if the afile has name collided with files in fileList except fileList.get(eindex) eindex can be -1, means go through the whole fileList;
        Parameters:
        afile - the file to be checked
        fileList - a list of files to be tested on
        eindex - index of the afile in working directory
        Returns:
        true if the file has conflicted with the file list except for the file at index eindex

      • isFileNameCollided

        public static boolean isFileNameCollided(java.io.File afile,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> fileList)
        Checks if the afile has name collided with files in the fileList
        Parameters:
        afile - the file to be checked
        fileList - the file list to be tested on
        Returns:
        true the file name is not collided with any one of the files in the fileList

        Parameters:

      • defaultNoOptionPane

        public static boolean defaultNoOptionPane(java.awt.Component parent,
                                          java.lang.String message,
                                          java.lang.String title,
                                          int messageType)
        Shows customized option dialog, default on "No" button
        Parameters:
        parent - parent determines the Frame in which the dialog is displayed; if null, or if the parentComponent has no Frame, a default Frame is used
        message - the Object to display
        title - title the title string for the dialog
        messageType - messageType an integer designating the kind of message this is, primarily used to determine the icon from the pluggable Look and Feel
        Returns:
        true if the user chose "Yes" option, false otherwise
